plugin.title: Soundproxy
plugin.author: LongTail Video
plugin.description:
This plugin sends realtime sound spectrum information to javascript. Use it to build equalizer / visualizer applications in javascript that react on the player. When playing video from another domain, security restrictions prevent the plugin from working. Either place player + video at the same domain or use a crossdomain.xml file.
Here's a couple of cool demos from Lars Nyboe Andersen: http://home5.inet.tele.dk/nyboe/flash/lab/externalSoundInterface/soundproxy_index.html

flashvar.name: bands
flashvar.description: This is the number of frequency bands sent to javascript. This corresponds to the number of entries in the 'bands' array sent to the listener.

flashvar.name: interval
flashvar.description: This is the resolution in milliseconds with which the sounddata is sent to javascript.

flashvar.name: listener
flashvar.description: This is the javascript function that receives the sounddata info. The listener receives an object with the following variables: - id (id of the player in the javascript DOM) - version (version of the player, e.g. 4.2.90) - client (plugin client, e.g. FLASH WIN 9.0.124 - bands (this is an array with values from -1 to 1; the amplitude of the frequency bands)
